item.title: Sola Security Deposits Hefty $30M Seed Funding
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
The financing was provided by S Capital and investor Mike Moritz, S32, Glilot Capital Partners, and several angel investors.

The post Sola Security Deposits Hefty $30M Seed Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of March 10, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of March 10, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: 1,600 Victims Hit by South American APT’s Malware
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
South American cyberespionage group Blind Eagle has infected over 1,600 organizations in Colombia in a recent campaign.

The post 1,600 Victims Hit by South American APT’s Malware appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: CISA Warns of Ivanti EPM Vulnerability Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
CISA has added three critical-severity flaws in Ivanti EPM to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog.

The post CISA Warns of Ivanti EPM Vulnerability Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Take Credit for X Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Information is coming to light on the cyberattack that caused X outages, but it should be taken with a pinch of salt.

The post Hackers Take Credit for X Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Elon Musk Claims X Being Targeted in ‘Massive Cyberattack’ as Service Goes Down
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Elon Musk claimed that the social media platform X was being targeted in a “massive cyberattack" that impacted availability.

The post Elon Musk Claims X Being Targeted in ‘Massive Cyberattack’ as Service Goes Down appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Trump Coins Used as Lure in Malware Campaign
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Binance is being spoofed in an email campaign using free TRUMP Coins as a lure leading to the installation of the ConnectWise RAT.

The post Trump Coins Used as Lure in Malware Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Details Disclosed for SCADA Flaws That Could Facilitate Industrial Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Palo Alto Networks has shared details on several high-severity Mitsubishi Electric and Iconics SCADA vulnerabilities.

The post Details Disclosed for SCADA Flaws That Could Facilitate Industrial Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cobalt Strike Abuse Dropped 80% in Two Years
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Fortra has shared an update on the effects of actions taken to reduce the abuse of Cobalt Strike by threat actors.

The post Cobalt Strike Abuse Dropped 80% in Two Years appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Developer Convicted for Hacking Former Employer’s Systems
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Davis Lu was convicted of sabotaging his employer’s systems through malicious code, and deleting encrypted data.

The post Developer Convicted for Hacking Former Employer’s Systems appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Google Paid Out $12 Million via Bug Bounty Programs in 2024
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
In 2024, Google paid out nearly $12 million in bug bounties through its revamped vulnerability reward programs.

The post Google Paid Out $12 Million via Bug Bounty Programs in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
